snippet: Ahmed Ferhani, who pleaded guilty to 10 charges on Tuesday, was arrested in Manhattan with another man, Mohamed Mamdouh.
abstract: Ahmed Ferhani, accused of plotting to blow up the largest synagogue in Manhattan, pleads guilty to 10 terrorism-related charges; Mohamed Mamdouh, second man charged in plot, also pleads guilty; both men were charged under a New York State terrorism statute passed after the 9/11 attacks in a case that did not involve federal authorities.
lead_paragraph: Ahmed Ferhani, who pleaded guilty to 10 charges on Tuesday, was arrested in Manhattan with another man, Mohamed Mamdouh.

headline.seo: Ahmed Ferhani Pleads Guilty in Plot to Blow Up Synagogue
headline.main: Queens Man Pleads Guilty in Plot to Blow Up Manhattan Synagogue
headline.print_headline: Queens Man Pleads Guilty in Plot to Blow Up Manhattan Synagogue
